name: io.mockd/mockd
title: mockd
description: Multi-protocol API mock server with support for HTTP, GraphQL, gRPC, WebSocket, MQTT, SSE, and SOAP. Create, manage, and verify mock endpoints through 16 AI-optimized tools. Features chaos engineering, stateful CRUD resources, request verification, and import from OpenAPI, Postman, HAR, WireMock, and cURL.

tools.name: manage_mock
tools.description: Create, retrieve, update, delete, list, or toggle mock endpoints.

tools.name: manage_context
tools.description: View or switch the active admin server context.

tools.name: manage_workspace
tools.description: List available workspaces or switch the active workspace.

tools.name: import_mocks
tools.description: Import mocks from OpenAPI, Postman, HAR, WireMock, cURL, and mockd YAML/JSON formats.

tools.name: export_mocks
tools.description: Export all current mocks as YAML or JSON configuration.

tools.name: get_server_status
tools.description: Get server health, ports, and statistics.

tools.name: get_request_logs
tools.description: Retrieve captured request/response logs with method, path, and protocol filters.

tools.name: clear_request_logs
tools.description: Permanently remove all captured request/response logs.

tools.name: get_chaos_config
tools.description: Retrieve the current chaos fault injection configuration.

tools.name: set_chaos_config
tools.description: Configure chaos fault injection: latency, error rates, bandwidth throttling, and named profiles.

tools.name: verify_mock
tools.description: Check whether a mock was called the expected number of times.

tools.name: get_mock_invocations
tools.description: List all recorded invocations for a specific mock.

tools.name: reset_verification
tools.description: Clear verification data for a specific mock or all mocks.

tools.name: manage_state
tools.description: Manage stateful CRUD resources that persist data across requests.

tools.name: manage_custom_operation
tools.description: Register and execute custom multi-step operations on stateful resources.
